page.title: 11THE WELCOME IN
page.content: This is the only remaining trading pub in the village.(there were three) . LANDLORD INTERVIEW "We can't look to local trade for our custom. Not many of the villagers are regular pub goers.We get tourists as customers-English, European and even Australian. We are in full view of traffic on the bypass for lunchtime custom.Evenings are much quieter, so we rely on local and Haverhill cust- omers. Disco nights they come from a radius of 20 miles.15years ago this was a transport cafe, and was run in conjunction with a garage next door. It then became the De Montford Arms, but when bought by the previous landlord was renamed the Welcome In. Although it looks modern,some of the interior features reflect its 18th Century origins. Some of the land was bought from the "Cornish" family.
